titleInfo.title: Lecturing with props at Brigade Officers' School at Vanderbilt University

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
mods.abstract: Officer from the Tennessee State Guard standing at the front of the room. He has a rifle balanced on the lecturn and a target propped behind him that reads "Today - The Bull's Eye; Tomorrow - The Enemy."

On July 9, 1944, a school of military application was conducted at Vanderbilt University by U.S. Army officers of the Fourth Service Command for officers and staffs of the Second Brigade of the Tennessee State Guard. This would involve the 2nd, 7th, and 10th Regiments of the TSG.
